kou commented on pull request #5589: ARROW-7101: [CI] Refactor docker-compose setup and use it with GitHub Actions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5589#discussion_r344603777
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .github/workflows/dev_cron.yml
 ##########
 @@ -36,6 +39,7 @@ jobs:
             const path = ".github/workflows/pull_request/jira_link.js";
 
 Review comment:
   Could you also move `.github/workflows/pull_request/*` to `.github/wokflows/dev_cron/`?

kszucs commented on pull request #5589: ARROW-7101: [CI] Refactor docker-compose setup and use it with GitHub Actions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5589#discussion_r344606707
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .github/workflows/dev_cron.yml
 ##########
 @@ -36,6 +39,7 @@ jobs:
             const path = ".github/workflows/pull_request/jira_link.js";
 
 Review comment:
   Done. BTW we should act on event instead of using cron tasks https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/events-that-trigger-workflows#pull-request-event-pull_request
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #5589: ARROW-7101: [CI] Refactor docker-compose setup and use it with GitHub Actions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5589#discussion_r344608198
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .github/workflows/dev_cron.yml
 ##########
 @@ -36,6 +39,7 @@ jobs:
             const path = ".github/workflows/pull_request/jira_link.js";
 
 Review comment:
   We can't run this on `pull_request` event.
   Because we don't have writable `GITHUB_TOKEN` by pull request from other repository.
   
   https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/events-that-trigger-workflows#pull-request-events-for-forked-repositories
   
   > The permissions for the `GITHUB_TOKEN` in forked repositories is read-only.
   
   If we use `on.schedule.cron`, we can use writable `GITHUB_TOKEN`.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #5589: ARROW-7101: [CI] Refactor docker-compose setup and use it with GitHub Actions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5589#discussion_r344608198
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .github/workflows/dev_cron.yml
 ##########
 @@ -36,6 +39,7 @@ jobs:
             const path = ".github/workflows/pull_request/jira_link.js";
 
 Review comment:
   We can't run this on `pull_request` event.
   Because we don't have writable `GITHUB_TOKEN` by pull request from forked repositories.
   
   https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/events-that-trigger-workflows#pull-request-events-for-forked-repositories
   
   > The permissions for the `GITHUB_TOKEN` in forked repositories is read-only.
   
   If we use `on.schedule.cron`, we can use writable `GITHUB_TOKEN`.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kszucs commented on pull request #5589: ARROW-7101: [CI] Refactor docker-compose setup and use it with GitHub Actions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5589#discussion_r344613944
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .github/workflows/dev_cron.yml
 ##########
 @@ -36,6 +39,7 @@ jobs:
             const path = ".github/workflows/pull_request/jira_link.js";
 
 Review comment:
   I'm interpreting that as that the triggered workflow runs on the base repository, thus it uses the (writable) GitHub token. The read-only note is about you cannot do nasty GitHub API calls acting from forks. 
   I assume you've tried the full request event trigger though.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #5589: ARROW-7101: [CI] Refactor docker-compose setup and use it with GitHub Actions
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5589#discussion_r344619618
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .github/workflows/dev_cron.yml
 ##########
 @@ -36,6 +39,7 @@ jobs:
             const path = ".github/workflows/pull_request/jira_link.js";
 
 Review comment:
   Yes. I tried `pull_request` action first. :-)
   
   This workflow may comment to pull requests on the base repository.
   If this wokflow is ran on `pull_request`, this workflow uses configuration in the pull request not in the base repository. If we have a writable `GITHUB_TOKEN` for `pull_request` event, evil fork repository can write any comments by putting evil code to `.github/workflows/dev_cron/*.js`.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org
